It could be an immediate transaction, an approval followed by a transaction, or indicate insufficient balance.

The human-readable formatted value you can render on a UI straight away.
For example, this will turn `0.01232343` to `1.23`, it will always round to `2` decimal points.

fields.name: health
fields.description: Get if the API is healthy

fields.name: chains
fields.description: Chains the protocol supports

fields.name: vaultDeposit
fields.description: Deposits assets (underlying tokens or its related aTokens) into the vault and mints a corresponding amount of vault shares to the receiver.

fields.name: vaultRedeemShares
fields.description: Redeems shares (vault shares) for the underlying assets or a tokens, which are sent to the receiver. The shares are burned from the owner.

fields.name: vault
fields.description: Get a vault

fields.name: vaults
fields.description: Get vaults

fields.name: userVaults
fields.description: User vaults they have shares in

fields.name: vaultDeploy
fields.description: Deploy a vault and earn fees from the yield

fields.name: vaultSetFee
fields.description: Update a vault's fee. You MUST be the owner of the vault to send this tx request.

fields.name: vaultWithdrawFees
fields.description: Withdraws accumulated fees from the specified vault. You MUST be the owner of the vault to send this tx request.

fields.name: vaultUserTransactionHistory
fields.description: User vault transaction history

fields.name: vaultUserActivity
fields.description: Vault user activity for a given vault and user, within a specified time window.

fields.name: vaultWithdraw
fields.description: Withdraws assets (underlying tokens or its related aTokens) from the vault and sends them to the receiver. The corresponding vault shares are burned from the owner.

fields.name: vaultMintShares
fields.description: Mints an exact amount of shares (vault shares) to the receiver by depositing the calculated amount of underlying or aTokens assets.

fields.name: vaultPreviewDeposit
fields.description: This will return you the amount of shares that would be minted to the receiver

fields.name: vaultPreviewMint
fields.description: This will return you the amount of assets that would be deposited by the caller

fields.name: vaultPreviewWithdraw
fields.description: This will return you the number of shares burnt based on the amount of assets you want to withdraw

fields.name: vaultPreviewRedeem
fields.description: This will return you the amount of assets that would be withdrawn by the receiver.

fields.name: vaultTransferOwnership
fields.description: Update a vault owner. You MUST be the owner of the vault to send this tx request.

fields.name: vaultCreateRecipientsConfiguration
fields.description:
Deploy a new recipients configuration contract for fee distribution.
You MUST be the owner of the vault to send this tx request.

fields.name: vaultSetRecipientsConfiguration
fields.description: Set the recipients configuration for the vault. You MUST be the owner of the vault to send this tx request.

fields.name: vaultRecipientConfiguration
fields.description: Get a vault recipients configuration

fields.name: markets
fields.description: Lists all the markets

fields.name: market
fields.description: Get a market

fields.name: borrow
fields.description: Create the transaction to borrow from a market

fields.name: approveBorrowCreditDelegation
fields.description: Approve a credit borrow delegator to be able to borrow on your behalf

fields.name: creditDelegateeAllowance
fields.description: Gets the amount delegated to the credit delegatee that can borrow on your behalf

fields.name: supply
fields.description: Create the transaction to supply to a market

fields.name: repay
fields.description: Create the transaction to repay to a market

fields.name: withdraw
fields.description: Create the transaction to withdraw from a market

fields.name: userSetEmode
fields.description: Create the transaction to toggle eMode for a market

fields.name: collateralToggle
fields.description: Enable/disable a specific supplied asset as collateral

fields.name: liquidate
fields.description: liquidate a non-healthy position collateral-wise, with Health Factor below 1

fields.name: userMarketState
fields.description: Returns the user account market data across all the reserves.

fields.name: usdExchangeRates
fields.description: The usd exchange rates for different tokens on a given market

fields.name: userBorrows
fields.description: Get all the user borrows positions

fields.name: userSupplies
fields.description: Get all the user supplies positions

fields.name: borrowAPYHistory
fields.description: Get the borrow APY history

fields.name: supplyAPYHistory
fields.description: Get the supply APY history

fields.name: permitTypedData
fields.description: Generate EIP-712 typed data for EIP-2612 permit signature

fields.name: reserve
fields.description: Get the reserve for on a market

fields.name: userTransactionHistory
fields.description: The user's market transaction history

fields.name: hasProcessedKnownTransaction
fields.description:
This lets you know the API has processed the known transaction hash, as the API uses caching to make things as fast
as possible, it has an invalidation task, so sometimes if the receipt is complete, we may still (rarely) serve
old data for 100-200ms longer, it's best to query after you got the receipt to be told that it is ready to go.
Note the invalidation is very quick, and most of the time it's present even before your receipt is returned this is to
cater for the race condition.

fields.name: forkTopUp
fields.description: Top up a balance for a user or yourself on the fork

fields.name: userMeritRewards
fields.description: The user merits reward information and transaction if you wish to claim

fields.name: savingsGhoBalance
fields.description:
Users saving GHO balance - note rewards are not paid out live onchain they paid out with the merit schema,
this can be claimed using `userMeritRewards`

fields.name: savingsGhoDeposit
fields.description: Deposit into savings GHO

fields.name: savingsGhoWithdraw
fields.description: Withdraw sGHO (savings GHO) back to GHO

If the reserve accepts native currency, for example, if you're on a reserve with asset WETH, it can

fields.description: The borrow info for the reserve - if its null the underlying token cannot be borrowed

fields.description: The reserve has been frozen all actions are stopped

fields.description: The reserve is paused you can still withdraw and some other actions

fields.description: If the reserve supports isolation mode this is defined and the configs are defined

fields.description: If the reserve can use flash loans on it

fields.deprecationReason: This field is no longer supported

fields.name: interestRateStrategyAddress
fields.description: The interest rate strategy address

fields.name: permitSupported
fields.description: Does the underlying reserve support permit

fields.name: incentives
fields.description:
This exposes the extra incentives you can earn from third parties (Merit) or from
incentives set by governance through the RewardsController.
Note Aave Labs does not guarantee third party program and accepts no liability to those

fields.name: eModeInfo
fields.description: The emode information for the reserve

fields.name: userState
fields.description: Get the user state on the reserve

fields.name: apy
fields.description: The annual percentage yield for borrowing this asset

fields.name: total
fields.description: The total amount borrowed from this reserve

fields.name: reserveFactor
fields.description: The reserve factor percentage

fields.name: availableLiquidity
fields.description: The available liquidity

fields.name: utilizationRate
fields.description: The reserve utilization rate

fields.name: baseVariableBorrowRate
fields.description: The base variable borrow rate - the minimum interest rate for borrowing

fields.name: variableRateSlope1
fields.description:
Variable rate slope 1 - the rate of interest increase when utilization rate is below optimal
This is the slope of the interest rate curve in the first segment (0% to optimal utilization)

fields.name: variableRateSlope2
fields.description:
Variable rate slope 2 - the rate of interest increase when utilization rate is above optimal
This is the slope of the interest rate curve in the second segment (optimal to 100% utilization)
Typically much steeper than slope1 to discourage over-utilization

fields.name: optimalUsageRate
fields.description:
The optimal usage rate - the utilization rate at which the variable rate curve transitions
from slope1 to slope2. This represents the target utilization rate for the reserve

fields.name: borrowingState
fields.description: Borrowing can have different states based on the criteria of the user or the market

fields.name: borrowCap
fields.description: The borrow cap of the reserve

fields.name: borrowCapReached
fields.description: The borrow cap is now full

enumValues.description: The user emode settings make this underlying not able to be borrowed

types.description:
The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8
character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to
represent free-form human-readable text.

inputFields.name: onBehalfOf
inputFields.description:
If not supplied, this will use `sender`. The address that will receive the corresponding aTokens. This is the only address that will be able to withdraw the asset from the pool.
This will be the same as msg.sender if the user wants to receive aTokens into their own wallet, or use a different address if the beneficiary
of aTokens is a different wallet

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type
validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution
behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally
including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing
additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description:
A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a
__DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description:
One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a
placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned
in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description:
Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which
has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description:
Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an
InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and
optionally a default value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description:
A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes
all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry
points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: description
fields.description:
description of __Schema for newer graphiql introspection schema
requirements

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description:
If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will
be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description:
If this server support subscription, the type that subscription
operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds
of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about
that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and
description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface
types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface,
provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose
other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description:
Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid
fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description:
Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are
valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: A reason for why it is deprecated, formatted using Markdown syntax

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: oneOf
directives.description: Indicates that an Input Object is a OneOf Input Object (and thus requires exactly one of its field be provided)

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Provides a scalar specification URL for specifying the behavior of custom scalar types.

args.name: url
args.description: URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.
